item.title: Elle add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "...I give you the mausoleum of all hope and desire...I give it to you not that you may remember time, but that you might forget it now and then for a moment and not spend all of your breath trying to conquer it. Because no battle is ever won he said. They are not even fought. The field only reveals to man his own folly and despair, and victory is an illusion of philosophers and fools." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Elle add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Read, read, read. Read everything -- trash, classics, good and bad, and see how they do it. Just like a carpenter who works as an apprentice and studies the master. Read! You'll absorb it. Then write. If it's good, you'll find out. If it's not, throw it out of the window." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Elle add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Memory believes before knowing remembers. Believes longer than recollects, longer than knowing even wonders." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Elle add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Don't be 'a writer'. Be writing." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Elle add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "In writing, you must kill all your darlings." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Elle add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Elle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elle add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Elle add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Elle add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Elle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Carson (Translator)
item.description: "Why does tragedy exist? Because you are full of rage. Why are you full of rage? Because you are full of grief." -- Anne Carson (Translator)

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "Words bounce. Words, if you let them, will do what they want to do and what they have to do." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "When I desire you a part of me is gone..." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Watch out for intellect, because it knows so much it knows nothing and leaves you hanging upside down, mouthing knowledge as your heart falls out of your mouth." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Put your ear down close to your soul and listen hard." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "As for me, I am a watercolor. I wash off." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Even so, I must admire your skill. You are so gracefully insane." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "I am stuffing your mouth with your promises and watching you vomit them out upon my face." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "I am alone here in my own mind. There is no map and there is no road. It is one of a kind just as yours is." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Live or die, but don't poison everything." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Love? Be it man. Be it woman. It must be a wave you want to glide in on, give your body to it, give your laugh to it, give, when the gravelly sand takes you, your tears to the land. To love another is something like prayer and can't be planned, you just fall into its arms because your belief undoes your disbelief." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "The joy that isn't shared dies young." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Don't bite till you know if it's bread or stone." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "It doesn't matter who my father was; it matters who I remember he was." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Being kissed on the back of the knee is a moth at the windowscreen...." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "O starry night, This is how I want to die" -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Suicide is, after all, the opposite of the poem." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Now I am going back And I have ripped my hand From your hand as I said I would And I have made it this far ..." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Elle add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "But I can't. Need is not quite belief." -- Anne Sexton
